text: New York City Council Search for: Find My District Budget Committees Land Use Legislation Press Releases Translate this page Google Translate District 15 Oswald Feliz Morrisania, Claremont Village-Claremont (East), Crotona Park East, Crotona Park, Mount Eden-Claremont (West), Claremont Park, Mount Hope, Fordham Heights, West Farms, Tremont, Belmont, University Heights (North)-Fordham, Bedford Park, Soundview-Bruckner-Bronx River, Pelham Parkway-Van Nest, Allerton, Bronx Park Councilmember Oswald Feliz is a lifelong resident of the Bronx, who proudly represents the 15th Council District – which includes the neighborhoods of Fordham, Belmont, East Tremont, West Farms, Van Nest, and Allerton. Oswald is a proud graduate of public schools in the Bronx, including P.S.46, M.S.45, Walton High School, Bronx Community College, and Lehman College. Eventually, he attended law school and obtained a law degree from CUNY School of Law. Prior to becoming a City Councilmember, Oswald worked as a tenant lawyer, and successfully defended Bronx residents in eviction and landlord harassment cases. Oswald represented a tenant association in a building-wide case against a landlord who failed to keep their building in good condition, and negotiated a settlement wherein tenants received approximately $100,000 from their landlord. In addition to working as a lawyer, Oswald served as an adjunct professor at Hostos Community College, where he had the privilege of teaching reading and writing to disadvantaged students in the Bronx. As a Councilmember, Oswald is dedicated to improving his home of the Bronx. He is committed to ensuring that access to good schools, safe streets, and opportunities for growth not be determined based on the neighborhood that one resides in. … READ MORE Committees Committee on Health Committee on Small Business (Chair) Committee on Civil Service and Labor Committee on Fire and Emergency Management Committee on Higher Education Committee on Housing and Buildings Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Sitings, and Dispositions Caucuses Black, Latino and Asian Caucus Councilmember Oswald Feliz is a lifelong resident of the Bronx, who proudly represents the 15th Council District – which includes the neighborhoods of Fordham, Belmont, East Tremont, West Farms, Van Nest, and Allerton. Oswald is a proud graduate of public schools in the Bronx, including P.S.46, M.S.45, Walton High School, Bronx Community College, and Lehman College. Oswald represented a tenant association in a building-wide case against a landlord who failed to keep their building in good condition, and negotiated a settlement wherein tenants received approximately $100,000 from their landlord. In addition to working as a lawyer, Oswald served as an adjunct professor at Hostos Community College, where he had the privilege of teaching reading and writing to disadvantaged students in the Bronx. As a Councilmember, Oswald is dedicated to improving his home of the Bronx. He is committed to ensuring that access to good schools, safe streets, and opportunities for growth not be determined based on the neighborhood that one resides in. … READ MORE Committees Committee on Health Committee on Small Business (Chair) Committee on Civil Service and Labor Committee on Fire and Emergency Management Committee on Higher Education Committee on Housing and Buildings Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Sitings, and Dispositions Caucuses Black, Latino and Asian Caucus Biography News Budget – FY26 District Office 573 East Fordham Road (Entrance on Hoffman Street) Bronx, NY 10458 718-842-8100 phone 347-597-8570 fax Legislative Office 250 Broadway, Suite 1759 New York, NY 10007 212-788-6966 phone 212-788-8977 fax Search for: Visit the Council We're located at New York City Hall. Council Members each have an office at 250 Broadway , as well as offices in each of their districts. We want to hear from you You can reach us via social media, email, paper mail, or at your district office. For issues specific to a neighborhood, it's best to contact the Council Member representing that community. Have questions, comments or feedback? Email us here.
